page.title: 13A DAY WITH THE HINDS
page.content: At about six am Dad gets up and milks the cows.About seven I get up for {school,}but at weekends I'm up at eight and busy on the farm. During the week I have breakfast and go to{school.}At weekends I help Dad.When the cows are milked I take them to their field.I help with the machinery usually.Once the parlour is scrubbed,the calves fed and the trough filled it is noon.The next job depends on what time of year it is.At about half four we milk the cows,this takes about two hours.Next we feed the calves.We go inside at about half nine .Our house is brick and about 150 years old. {By { Mark Hinds.}
